page.title: 08STREET SERVICES
page.content: Monday June 24th 1985 and Mr.Jackson arrived at 10am from Ashford. Class 3 from Tenterden Junior were going out in groups to look at street services,drains,hydrants and lighting. Mr.Jackson was going to explain things to each of us. We found out that each house has its own stop-cock and outside the flats were six little water covers one for each of the flats Mr.Jackson used his special levers and removed some of the manhole covers so that we could see the steps leading down to the sewers. They were quite clean really. We looked at the different lamp posts. Some were old gas lamps converted,others were the "Chinese hat type". One near the road junction had a tiny bulb on top which was very sensitive to light and worked with all the other automatic mechanism to switch on when it was dark.
